intro: Daucus carota var. purpuriflorus, commonly known as the purpleflowered carrot, is a rare and ornamental variant of the common carrot. It is characterized by its striking purple flowers that bloom in umbels, contrasting with its green foliage. The plant belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. It typically grows in temperate climates and prefers well-drained soil. This variety is less commonly cultivated for its edible roots but is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
